verbs.description: undazzle (third-person singular simple present undazzles, present participle undazzling, simple past and past participle undazzled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To free from dazzlement; to clear (the senses, the vision, etc.).
examples: With an effort I strove to undazzle my sense, and with my heart as much as with my lips I murmured, “Murder!” And it seemed to me as if it were he who murmured it, not I—or at least that our two beings murmured it as one.
